definition: to feel sb's pulse
ordinal number/day of a month/mark/sign/business establishment/size/ship suffix/horn (wind instrument)/bugle call/assumed name/to take a pulse/classifier used to indicate number of people
roar/cry/CL:個|个[ge4]
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
see 脈脈|脉脉[mo4 mo4]

sentences.english: The doctor felt her pulse on her wrist.
sentences.chinese: 這位醫生在她的手腕上號脈。

sentences.english: The doctor was feeling her pulse.
As I touched the living Buddha's wrist I could feel his eyes gazing at me expectantly.
sentences.chinese: 號脈時，我感到他看我的目光中帶有些許期待。

sentences.english: Put your hand on the wrist cushion. I'll take your pulse.
sentences.chinese: 把手放在脈枕上，我給你號脈。

definition: body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
examination room (in a doctor's office)
attributive (modifier)
fiends (idiom); devils and monsters
medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]
(TCM) pulse feeling and palpitation, one of the four methods of diagnosis 四診|四诊[si4 zhen3]
flippant and insincere (piece of writing or speech)/glib-tongued/oily
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
sharp ears and keen eyes (idiom)/keen and alert/perceptive
to churn out large quantities without regard for quality (idiom); rough and slipshod work
to make a fool of oneself
reckless/extremely daring
improvisation
to help a mother give birth
kindergarten bus/baby carriage/stroller
